title: Bugsplat while loading into league
body:
Um, hey I've played league quite awhile and I just switched from my TV over to my monitor and league will bug-splat right when it goes into a game, I just switched it so I know for a fact that I'm coming across a bug unless there was an update within 9 hours that made it impossible for me to load into game. So please please please please help me I love this game and any help would be good

(Yes i deleted this game and reinstalled waste of 3 hours)

replies.body:
What's most likely happening is that League is trying to load your old display resolution from when you played on the TV, which causes issues when your current monitor likely can't display the same resolution. We should be able to resolve this by clearing out the input file that stores the resolution with the following steps:

First, **log into the Client** then navigate to your config folder, which should be in this directory:

>**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

Delete these two files:
**- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json**

Once you've deleted those files, hop into a custom match to confirm the changes went through and that you can now successfully load into a match. Let me know if this worked!

Thank you this seems promising, but being the not so tech savvy me where would this configuration folder be? if it is in the regular folder then this isn't showing anything for me when i look it up. When i click on league the only files it has in it are my replays, because i deleted and reinstalled

Ah, no worries! So you can get to the folder by hitting the start button (bottom left corner, looks like the windows logo), then hit either **My Computer/Computer** if you're on windows XP-7, or **File Explorer** (folder icon) if you're on Windows 8-10. Make sure you're in the **Computer** directory that shows your (C:) drive and DVD drive. If you aren't, find it on the toolbar on the left side and click on it. Double-click on the Windows (C:) drive, next double-click on the **Riot Games** folder and then double-click the **League of Legends** folder. You'll finally be able to double-click on the **Config** folder so you can take care of those two files for the reset.

I hope this helped!

We'll need to take a look at your system logs to troubleshoot this further. I recommend running those logs using our [**HRT App**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/LniMWwQk-lcu-crashing-immediately-after-login). You can then attach those logs to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can get back to you.

Lmk if you ran into any issues.
